info.name: Solve360 4 Firefox v 2.0
info.description:
This style fits the Solve360 interface on Mozilla Firefox to my personal needs. The use case is a small laptop screen, in my case it's a HP EliteBook 8440p.

Focus is on
- ease of reading,
- the amount and order of displayed information, and
- a good overview.

This is achieved by some :hover - styles. Information is kept short in base view, and more info is released upon mouse hovering over an item.
info.additionalInfo:
v 2.0

The v2.0 style condenses the upper overview-pane in contacts and projects view, too, until the mouse hovers over it. So, e.g. when you're opening a project, more of the recent events and tasks are visible, rather than the seldomly changing base data.

Some minor adjustments to font sizes and spaces are included, too.
